chargeHist.descr: Poessess Firearm - Dom Abuse or Child Abuse Injunction

result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Received and Filed: Pretrial Services Discharge Report 10-26-22

Defendant Damon Remel Laye in court.  Attorney Mark Stuart Tishberg appeared by video for Damon Remel Laye.  Attorney James C Griffin in court for State of Wisconsin. 

Case in Court for Calendar call. Discussion placed on the record. Attorney Tishberg filed Notice of Retainer. Judge VACATED stayed bench warrant. Defense provided update regarding Defendant's failure to appear at last hearing. Court ordered case adjourned for Status Conference, branch 2.
Status conference scheduled for November 17, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Received and Filed.
Attorney Mark S. Tishberg.

Adjustment Number: 22A 097015,
Payable Number: 1038230,

Received and Filed: Pretrial Services Supervision Report 10-12-22

Defendant Damon Remel Laye not in court.  Attorney Mark Stuart Tishberg appeared by video for Damon Remel Laye.  Attorney James C Griffin in court for State of Wisconsin. 

Case in court for a status of counsel.  Attorney Tishberg will file a Notice of Retainer.  Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered a bench warrant issued but stayed the issuance until the next court date.  Court scheduled a calendar call and advises Defense counsel that Mr. Laye must appear in person for calendar call.  Case adjourned for to Branch 2, Rm 635 CH.
Calendar call scheduled for October 13, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Received and Filed: Pretrial Services Status Report - 10-03-2022

Defendant Damon Remel Laye not in court, in custody.  Prosecuting attorney James C Griffin in court for the State of Wisconsin. Attorney Tishberg appeared in preliminary hearing court. Attorney Fred Richardson appeared and stated that he is not counsel of record. Case is adjourned for status of counsel in Branch 02.
Status conference scheduled for October 4, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Damon Remel Laye in court, appear by video with attorney Mark Stuart Tishberg, appear in person.  Defendant Damon Remel Laye in custody.  Abby Rockendorf appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin. 
 Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Court took Judical Notice to case number 20FA973. Sworn for the State: Glendale Officer A. Nazario.   State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 02.  Scheduling conference scheduled for September 12, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 3.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Damon Remel Laye in court with attorney Evan Barrett Weitz.  Defendant Damon Remel Laye in custody.  Amy E Spanczak appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Damon Remel Laye appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Childs, Branch 02.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 1, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
